thread.title: Harrison Ford spotted as air investigation is put on hold
thread.title_full: Harrison Ford spotted as air investigation is put on hold

title: Harrison Ford spotted as air investigation is put on hold
text: Harrison Ford is spotted for the first time returning to the airport where he nearly flew INTO a Boeing 737 as FAA reveals his investigation will be delayed due to massive backlog Actor Harrison Ford, 74, was spotted driving to Santa Monica Airport in California on Wednesday On Monday the Hollywood legend was involved in a near miss with a Boeing 737 full of passengers there The FAA said Wednesday Ford's investigation was on hold due to a backlog of more pressing cases The avid pilot could receive a formal reprimand, or even lose his license altogether after the near crash Ford was flying his single engine Husky when he mistakenly aimed for the taxiway at John Wayne Airport He had been told to use the adjacent runway. The taxiway was occupied by a Boeing 737 waiting for him He barely missed the American Airlines 737 loaded with 110 passengers, flying just over the top Ford was captured on air traffic control recordings asking: 'Was that airliner meant to be underneath me?' Star Wars actor has been in a number of crashes in his vintage aircraft over the years, most recently in 2015
